Our 2014-15 partners in France are gearing up for their #EUmanagestress conference in Paris on Thursday. More info: http://t.co/M5BTMPvYSL
We will post links to the presentations when we get them. That's it from the conference in Athens. Hope live tweet was useful #gr2014eu
Mr Christodoulou thanked the Commissioner, the Deputy Minister and all the contributors. #gr2014eu
The European Social Model has been damaged by the crisis and together with the ILO, the EU is rebuilding social dialogue.
The Commission will also work closely with the ILO in the future, says the Commissioner #gr2014eu
The Commission will monitor the implementation of the strategic framework, continued Mr Andor.
To implement new framework we need partnerships. We need coherence. We need commitment, said Mr Andor. #gr2014eu
Commissioner Andor said that we need to prevent occupational diseases #gr2014eu
We need to be mindful of new risks, says Mr Andor, and we also need to evaluate existing legislation to ensure its fit for purpose.
Mr Andor says we need to better enforce existing legislation and support our inspectors. #gr2014eu
We need to consolidate national OSH strategies, says Mr Andor. #gr2014eu
Mr Andor says the new framework doesn't have all the answers but it has a roadmap.#gr2014eu
How do we ensure a sustainable working life for our ageing population?
How do we keep workers safe in this globally competitive environment, asks Commissioner Andor. #gr2014eu
There was a long consultation purpose in advance of this OSH Strategic Framework. #gr2014eu
The new Strategic Framework will contribute to Europe2020 strategy and will help micro and small enterprises #gr2014eu
Human suffering, sick leave, economic costs are all unacceptable, says the EU Commissioner Andor #gr2014eu
Commissioner Andor says that a level playing field is very important. But we cannot afford to be complacent #gr2014eu
We have in the EU a general legislative framework, supported by Member States #gr2014eu
Mr Andor says that Europe has clear added value in the area if OSH. #gr2014eu
The most competitive economies on the EU manage to have proper social dialogue and better working conditions #gr2014eu
The Commission took a number of important initiatives in the area of OSH over the years #gr2014eu
Commissioner Andor said that employment has suffered and also the quality of employment over the last years. #gr2014eu
Commissioner Andor says that the EU is in recovery and the meeting is timely because of new OSH Strategic Framework. #gr2014eu
The Italian presidency will ask Commission for guidelines to help Member States move  together on harmony on OSH.
Ms Rosanna Margiotta informs everyone about the Italian OSH conference on December 3-4, focussing on SMEs.
Our European Commission colleagues with Commissioner Andor at Athens conference #gr2014eu http://t.co/Rb1Gtey6C6
The Italian EU Presidency representative pledges her support #gr2014eu
The Deputy Minister signals his willingness to work together with EU and EU-OSHA to make a difference #gr2014eu
Deputy Minister Kegkeroglou says we need a systematic, participatory approach on OSH in Europe #gr2014eu
Commissioner Andor joins with the Greek Deputy Minister Kegkeroglou.#gr2014eu http://t.co/4xERfyqms5
We are joined by Greek Deputy Minister Kegkeroglou and Commissioner Andor here in Aghens #gr2014eu
Asia and Africa will wipe Europe out if we don't learn to cope with changes, says Mr de Meester. #gr2014eu
Some companies are enlightened, says Mr van Veelen, and look carefully at workloads.#gr2014eu
Mr van Veelen says many people have workloads that are far too high and the line between work and leisure are blurred. Some
Mr can  Veelen says that many people in our workforce are suffering because of job cuts like police, care and health workers.
Mr de Meester said that we need to work on ageing workforce. We need to grow the labour force. Change is a law of life.
Mr de Meester said that most people have no problem dealing with their jobs. We can't all move to half time jobs. #gr2014eu
Mr van Veelen says that we have an enormous number of people unemployed and a lot colleagues working the jobs of two people. #gr2014eu
Mr Metze says that the issue is to help people and find a place for people to be treated in hospitals. #gr2014eu
Ms Jarnstedt from Swedish trade unions says that not everyone can achieve one hundred per cent. We need to accept that. #gr2014eu
Ms Vermeylen says that there will be specific questions in the next surveys to allow for better understanding #gr2014eu
Mr Niemiec mentions European Disability Forum and joint work to help them reintegrate into labour market #gr2014eu
Dr Takala said that in Sweden they trained inspectors to spot  psychosocial factors. There are good practices around! Use them!#gr2014eu
EU-OSHA will present successful good practices and practical solutions to get people back to work and to keep them on work!
A key aspect of this is social dialogue, says Dr Sedlatschek. Involve the social partners #gr2014eu
Dr Sedlatschek says disability and chronic diseases can be dealt with effectively. There are strategies at political and company level.
We need proper risk assessment for people with mental health problems, says Ms Perimaki from the Finnish trade unions.
Mr Van Mierlo says that we need common sense when approaching psychosocial risk and timeliness is important #gr2014eu
This topic does not require a legislative approach, says Mr Van Mierlo. In the Netherlands, they have developed a useful tool. #gr2014eu
Work can contribute to health and Wellbeing, says Mr Van Mierlo.
Prevention of psychosocial risk makes sound business sense, says Mr Van Mierlo. #gr2014eu
Mr Van Mierlo says that you can discuss psychosocial context of workplace. ESENER shows us that prevention is key #gr2014eu
Mr Van Mierlo says that psychosocial issues can be very sensitive, very subjective and difficult to identify root problem.#gr2014eu
Mr Mario Van Mierlo speaks on behalf of European employers. Psychosocial issues are very complicated, he says.
Mr Suomaa says there can be multiple exposures and we must recognize link between psychosocial risks and say, MSDs.
Mr Suomaa refers to Finnish research. Prevent disability and diseases and don't just focus on accidents.
Workers who are out for three or four months are at a high risk of not coming back. Workers should be helped to continue their work.
Mr Suomaa says preventive measures must be aimed at all workers and not just people affected with mental disease. It requires leadership.
Mr Suomaa says there are difficulties with definitions of osychosocial risks. #gr2014eu
Mr Suomaa says that mental disorders can be difficult to prove and can often lead to early retirement. #gr2014eu
Leo Suomaa from Finland now speaks on behalf of EU governments. Psychosocial risks are being recognized more by insurance business.
Mr Niemiec says that employers and unions are working at EU level and recognize the importance of OSH in the future #gr2014eu
Involve workers  and involve trade unions, says Mr Niemiec.#gr2014eu
Existing legislation should be properly enforced, says Mr Niemiec. #gr2014eu
The causes of work related illnesses can be multiple ones, says Mr Niemiec. #gr2014eu
Mr Niemiec said we need to pay more attention to work-related diseases and reducing them has to be our priority.#gr2014eu
Mr Niemiec, Deputy General Secretary of the ETUC, says we need well-designed tools. #gr2014eu
Panel discussion begins with Josef Niemiec from the ETUC. A lot of work done in the ACSH on prevention. #gr2014eu
Suicide cannot be left out of this discussion, says Mr Wilkerson. We need best practices in our workplaces. #gr2014eu
We need business leadership in the issue of workplace mental health and depression, says Mr Wilkerson. #gr2014eu
Employers have to face up to their responsibilities.  It is very urgent to deal with depression, says Mr Wilkerson.
The issue of mental health in the workplace is an international matter, says Mr Wilkerson. We have an abundance of tools. #gr2014eu
Mr Wilkerson outlines devastating effects of depression and it is not limited to older people.  It develops in the young and continues...
Mr Wilkinson is Canadian and his address is: The Depression Crisis: the Global Economy under Attack" #gr2014eu
Mr Bill Wilkerson is up next. He is the Executive Chairman of Business Leadership Forum to Target Depression on the Workplace #gr2014eu
We forgot to mention who is chairing this session: it is Carl Anders from the Irish employers, IBEC. #gr2014eu
Dr Tziaferi said her federation is actively involved on the EU-OSHA stress campaign. Good news! #gr2014eu
Occupational nurses are ideally placed to identify and help psychosocial illness sufferers #gr2014eu
Dr Styliani addresses psychosocial risks and nursing and presents results of major study #gr2014eu
Dr Styliani Tziaferi, President of the Federation of Occupational Health Nurses within the European Union is the next speaker here on Athens
Cool video about EU-OSHA campaign  https://t.co/2Zbc9yqGSU
We will run a good practice award competition in EU-OSHA.  So, get involved!
There is a variety of tools available to help you manage stress, says Dr Milczarek.
The campaign e-guide especially focused on MSEs. It's not advocating any particular approach but motivating managers to select from tools.
Dr Milczarek runs through all the resources available to the public if they wish to take part in the world's biggest OSH campaign!
Dr Milczarek says that small investment has big returns.  Stress at work can be managed like any other hazard #gr2014eu
The biggest obstacle to managing psychosocial risks in work is sensitivity - managers unwilling to go there.#gr2014eu
Dr Milczarek shows that systematic management of psychosocial risks in companies is still comparatively rare, especially in MSEs.#gr2014eu
Our own Dr Malgorzata Milczarek is now presenting the latest EU-OSHA campaign "Managing stress and psychosocial risks at work."
Dr Takala concludes that occupational diseases are common, and common diseases are occupational. Zero harm - Vision Zero.#gr2014eu
Look at the difference between perceived and real risk. People far more scared of flying than work, but the latter kills far more people!
The size of the workforce has no link to the unemployed, says Dr Takala.  Older people create jobs for younger ones, they don't block them.
We should not overlook the impact of osychosocial factors and these can be eliminated too.  We can act here.  Identify, reduce, eliminate.
Occupational cancer can be eliminated, because we can eliminate exposures! That is feasible! #gr2014eu
Don't rely on official statistics, says Dr Takala.  There is massive under-reporting everywhere. #gr2014eu
The UK has done very well in preventing accidents.  Look at the example of the Olympics, says Dr Takala #gr2014eu
Lower back pain is the biggest issue causing people to lose working years, says Dr Takala #gr2014eu
Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease is also a big issue in UK for example, alongside cancer, says Dr Takala #gr2014eu
Dr Takala says there is an increase globally in work related deaths.  Work-related cancers are increasing #gr2014eu
Dr Jukka Takala, former EU-OSHA Director and now Executive Director of Workplace Safety and Health Institute, Singapore, presents new data.
The EU is an institutional laboratory for the quality if life.  Member Sates differ hugely in this matter of ageing and labour market.
Governments should take direct labour market measures to counter ageism, says Prof Tinios #gr2014eu
Individuals need to be able to plan their retirement. Employers should see older workers as an opportunity, not a threat, adds Prof Tinios.
If nothing is done, the supply of labour of women will be very affected by care work demands, says Prof Tinios.#gr2014eu
The presence of women increases the productivity of older workers and reduces the productivity of younger workers! Study from car industry.
Does productivity fall with age? Yes, for physically taxing work, says Prof Tinios #gr2014eu
For women, the issue is not just work/leisure trade-off. It is also juggling work/unpaid work and care work, says Prof Tinios #gr2014eu
New generations of women have a different relationship to the world of work. Complex picture for women. More career women. #gr2014eu
Prof Tinios mentions the work/leisure trade-off. As people become more prosperous, they want more leisure and this is very typical for men.
Can people work longer?  All studies show a clear health link. Disability trends very important.  Can we reduce disability? #gr2014eu
The labour market is not a game of musical chairs, Prof Tinios says. It's always good to increase the supply of labour idle workers present
In a time of high unemployment, is it not insane to ask people to work longer?  Should we not work less, asks Prof Tinios #gr2014eu
Prof Tinios examines the supply of and demand for labour.  #gr2014eu
Prof Tinios approaches the ageing issue from a macroeconomic perspective, particularly looking at pensions #gr2014eu
Professor Platon Tinios, University of Piraeus, is the next speaker. "Ageing as a multidimensional phenomenon: challenge or opportunity?"
We must move towards a coherent policy agenda for sustainable work, involving all key actors #gr2014eu

We are tweeting from the EU Greek Presidency conference in 
Athens on The future of Occupational Safety & Health in Europe #gr2014eu
Autonomy plays a big role in making work sustainable, says Ms Vermeylen, as well as work-life balance, support from colleagues and managers.
There is an increase in working life duration, but women work eight years fewer than men, says Ms Vermeylen #gr2014eu
Work and working life are changing, says Ms Vermeylen. #gr2014eu
Ms Vermeylen, Eurofound, addresses the demographic challenge: sustainable work over the life course
Next up is Greet Vermeylen, Research Manager, Eurofound #gr2014eu
ESENER will also address ageing issues, says the EU-OSHA director.#gr2014eu
Dr Sedlatachek emphasizes the topic of EU-OSHA's next campaign which will deal with safe and healthy work at any age.
Dr Sedlatschek said that in EU-OSHA we are mainstreaming ageing workforce issues into many ongoing activities #gr2014eu
The EU-OSHA Director poses the question: how do we manage OSH in the context of an ageing workforce?
Our project aims to improve work ability and prolong working life and increase employment, says Dr Sedlatachek.
The Director of EU-OSHA, Dr Christa Sedlatschek, presents "Healthy and safe ageing for a sustainable working life."
Our Chair this morning is Mr Stuart Bristow from the Health and Safety Authority in the United Kingdom #gr2014eu
Day Two of the Greek EU Presidency conference on the future of OSH is kicking off now in Athens. #gr2014eu
RT @EU_Social: Follow @EU_OSHA for livetweeting of today's @gr2014eu conference on Occupational Health and Safety #OSH #healthandsafety
Tomorrow, Commissioner Andor will join the EU Greek Presidency OSH conference, along with many other luminaries. #gr2014eu
We are coming to the end of Day One of Greek EU Presidency Conference on OSH. We resume at 9h Athens time tomorrow morning.

annotations.normalized_text: Day One of Greek EU Presidency Conference

text: Mr Cammarota has given us all a lot to think about...
Mr Cammarota advocates the creation of an EU OSH Information system which would also provide policy guidance #gr2014eu
Mr Cammarota recommends developing a common intragovernmental model of OSH governance #gr2014eu
Mr Cammarota urges further consolidation of national OSH strategies and policies.
Mr Cammarota examines the role of national strategies. #gr2014eu
Next and final speaker today in Athens is Mr Antonio Cammarota from the European Commission.#gr2014eu
Mr Engels says that workers too have a responsibility for their own behaviour and their own health and safety #gr2014eu
Talking about tools is Mr Francois Engels from the European Association of Craft, Small and Medium-sized Enterprises, in Athens conference.
The right tools for small businesses can be morale-boosting, says Ms Gough #gr2014eu
Greek EU Presidency OSH conference examining how to help small businesses in Europe with Irish case study #gr2014eu
Ms Gough describes ways of engaging with small businesses in Ireland.
From Ireland, we hear from Ms Paula Gough, Health and Safety Authority, Ireland.#gr2014eu
Lorenzo MUNAR shows how e-tools are a very potent global resource. #gr2014eu
Next up in EU Presidency OSH conference is our own Lorenzo MUNAR, examining the added value of e-tools with OiRA as an example. Interesting!
Here is our link to the Greek EU Presidency conference on OSH. We will add to it when we get the presentations. https://t.co/1PT7klH5Sn
Speaking next is Mr Jean-Michel Miller of Eurofound on Social Dialogue on MSEs #gr2014eu
The future of OSH in Europe is the title of the EU Greek presidency conference in Athens today and tomorrow #gr2014eu
Chairing the next session of the EU Presidency conference on OSH here in Athens is Mr Viktor Kempa, European Trade Union Institute
Deputy Minister Kegkeroglou reiterates the importance of OSH for EU workers. http://t.co/wJdWwO7PmN
Deputy Minister Kegkeroglou says it is better to have a strategy which needs strengthening than having none at all.
Opening session Greek EU Presidency conference on the future of occupational safety and health. http://t.co/tHVha4dnlb
Mr van Veelen said that the burden of work is increasing and that is why so many people are ill and off work.
Mr van Veelen said in the Netherlands that one out of five people working in care of the elderly will lose their jobs.
Mr Schaefer says that political support is crucial.  Mainstreaming OSH is needed.  Involvement of stakeholders.
Mr de Meester doesn't think that OSH is high on the political agenda.  We should be higher!  We need the fulcrum and lever of Archimedes.
The Chair wonders how we can keep OSH high on the political agenda at all levels.
Want to join our Italian national partners in Florence for the #EUmanagestress conference on Wednesday? Register here http://t.co/2p5heS5zVe
Mr Schaefer welcomes the new emphasis on work-related diseases and he welcomes the start of new discussions.
Mr Schaefer said that it is good the Commission highlights the debate and keeps it on the high political agenda.
The Commission has already said the new strategic framework will be reviewed very soon, said Mr Schaefer.
Mr Schaefer said that there was a lot of ambition at the beginning.  This new framework is a prolongation of the expired OSH Strategy.
Mr Schaefer, on behalf of Governments, said that he cannot anticipate the joint response of all governments to the document as it is new.
He is worried that the correct image of reality is not represented there. Mr de Meester said that we lack support to achieve our goals.
Will the new OSH policy framework really get results, asks Mr de Meester.  He has serious doubts.
Mr De Meester representing the European employers welcomes the new OSH Strategic Framework.
Mr van Veelen says there is an over emphasis on the notion of simplification.  Why is this the main focus, he asks.
Mr van Weelen from the European trade unions opens the panel discussion.  There are problems with the new Strategic Framework, in his view.
The panel discussion is beginning here in the EU Presidency OSH conference in Athens!
Now the challenge is to successfully implement the new Framework, says Mr Alvarez. The process has started. Open debate with stakeholders.
Mr Alvarez says that the OiRA tool developed by the Bilbao Agency is a great support to companies.
Mr Alvarez says that there is a particular need to recognize the demographic trends on Europe #gr2014eu #healthandsafety
Special attention should be paid to work related cancers, lung diseases, skin diseases, asthma, chronic conditions and asbestos.
Improving implementation in Member States is crucial, says Mr Alvarez, at the EU conference in Athens #healthandsafety
Mr Alvarez says that there is a clear need for policy action to improve the OSH situation in the EU.  Too many accidents and deaths.
Mr Francisco Jesus Alvarez Hidalgo of the Commission presents new EU Strategic Framework on OSH 2014-2020.
Ms Maria-Teresa Moitinho de Almeida of the European Commission takes over the chairing of the meeting.  She stresses role of social partners
She commended the engagement of the Greek EU Presidency to workplace health and safety. Our work together is impressive, she says.
